column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and Covid-19 vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.Four more coronavirus-related deaths have been reported in Northern Ireland on Monday.Deaths are measured by recording those who died within 28 days of receiving a positive result in a test for coronavirus.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in Northern Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 2
column2: 548.Another 903 cases of coronavirus were reported on Monday
column4: 030 on Sunday.That includes cases confirmed from samples taken in recent days
column5: not necessarily just in the latest 24-hour reporting period.A total of 234
column6: 739 cases of the virus have been confirmed in Northern Ireland since the pandemic began.The Department of Health's Covid-19 dashboard is not updated over the weekend.The most recent figures on Monday showed there were 345 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals
column7: compared to 373 on Friday.The number of patients with Covid-19 in hospital intensive care units was 28 on Monday
column8: down from 31 on Friday.Last updated 27 September at 14:00  BSTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandA total of 2
